item.title: adde upgrade
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: ADDE upgrade

Revision History:
    2015-08-05 11:03:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
- (sample link from an archived ticket) http://download.adde.ai.accenture.com/release/38576265/adde-v5.3.2-b20618.tar.gz

Relevant servers:
- hhs-accenture-01.prod.hhs.local
- hhs-accenture-02.prod.hhs.local

Prerequisites
- Ticket exists for this upgrade
- you have scheduled a window to do this


Steps:
- backup the existing instance of adde
- stop the instance of adde. There is an init script to do this
- download the file to a location of your choosing
- untar it
- copy the contents into the specified folder
- start the instance of adde using the init script




=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.

item.title: CTAC monthly patching
item.description:
Subject: GSA CGI Monthly Access check Revision History: 2022-07-29 - Created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

confirm login to laptop; connect to VPN via laptop (3 minutes) confirm login to VDI (5 minutes)

  • requires log in to https://otp.gsa.gov/ git pull code repositories (3 minutes) change password (5 minutes)
  • https://reset.gsa.gov change FCS password (5 minutes)
  • https://idm.helix.gsa.gov confirm log into gmail; review unread email (20 minutes) confirm log into cj-jira.usa.gov and access to application project (3 minutes) confirm login to datadog (3 minutes) https://cmccp.ddog-gov.com/ confirm login to jenkins (3 minutes) https://jenkins-mcaas.helix.gsa.gov/job/CMCCP/job/core/job/CMCCP/ confirm login to service now (3 minutes) https://gsa.servicenowservices.com/sp/?id=my_workbench Misc troubleshooting (10 minutes)

================================================= This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of CTAC.

item.title: DARMIS
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Restart DARMIS (how to)

Revision History:
    2016-08-8 09:10:46 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Prerequisites
- Bishal has added your Mac’s ssh key to the server

Assets
- darmis.ctacorp.com

Steps:
- From the CTAC office (or CTAC VPN), ssh into darmis.ctacorp.com…ahem, as the root user
ssh root@darmis.ctacorp.com
- switch to the ruby-app user
sudo su - ruby-app
- go to the DARMIS current directory
cd /appdata/darmis_prod/current
- kill the unicorn process (if any)
ps -ef | grep unicorn | grep darmis_prod | grep master | awk '{print $2}' | xargs kill -9
(The above command was not tested)
- start up the unicorn process again
unicorn -c /appdata/darmis_prod/current/config/unicorn_darmis_prod.rb -E production -


=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: percussion file permission denied errors
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Percussion - File Permission Error 

Revision History:
    2015-09-17 12:25:24 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)
If you get an error like below on percussion.  Check the /tmp directory for java temp files.  (Yes, they persist across restarts.)  These files may have improper permissions.


2015-09-17 11:53:24,959 ERROR [org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.[jboss.web].[localhost].[/Rhythmyx].[RhythmyxServlet]] Servlet.service() for servlet RhythmyxServlet threw exception
java.io.IOException: Permission denied
    at java.io.UnixFileSystem.createFileExclusively(Native Method)
    at java.io.File.createTempFile(File.java:2001)
    at com.percussion.util.PSPurgableTempFile.calculatePath(Unknown Source)
    at com.percussion.util.PSPurgableTempFile.<init>(Unknown Source)
    at com.percussion.server.content.PSFormContentParser.parseNextBlock(Unknown Source)
    at com.percussion.server.content.PSFormContentParser.parseMultipartForm(Unknown Source)
    at com.percussion.server.content.PSFormContentParser.parse(Unknown Source)
    at com.percussion.server.PSRequest.parseBody(Unknown Source)
    at com.percussion.servlets.PSAppServlet.service(Unknown Source)
    at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:803)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:290)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
    at com.percussion.webdav.PSWebDavRequestFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
    at com.percussion.servlets.PSSecurityFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
    at com.percussion.servlets.PSCharacterSetFilter.doFilter(Unknown Source)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
    at org.jboss.web.tomcat.filters.ReplyHeaderFilter.doFilter(ReplyHeaderFilter.java:96)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:235)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:206)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:230)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContextValve.invoke(StandardContextValve.java:175)
    at org.jboss.web.tomcat.security.SecurityAssociationValve.invoke(SecurityAssociationValve.java:182)
    at org.jboss.web.tomcat.security.JaccContextValve.invoke(JaccContextValve.java:84)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:127)
    at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorReportValve.invoke(ErrorReportValve.java:102)
    at org.jboss.web.tomcat.service.jca.CachedConnectionValve.invoke(CachedConnectionValve.java:157)
    at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke(StandardEngineValve.java:109)
    at org.apache.catalina.connector.CoyoteAdapter.service(CoyoteAdapter.java:262)
    at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process(Http11Processor.java:844)
    at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.process(Http11Protocol.java:583)

item.title: percussion ri migration
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Percussion Migration 

Revision History:
    2015-07-06 14:00:00 - Version 1 created by Bao Nguyen
    2015-07-06 00:00:00 - Version 2 - Add some info - Paul Rigor
    2015-07-07 00:00:00 - Version 3 - Add some info - Bao
    2015-07-07 00:00:00 - Version 4 - Add some more info - Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

- stop Rhythmx on the server (this is to remain stopped)
	cd /appdata/stopbullying/Rhythmx
	../Rhythmx stop ..
- migrate the app from the On Demand instance to perc-migration-as-01
	Here are some example commands to gather the data….
	- On the On Demand server:

	* Copy the Rhythmx folder:
	cd /appdata/stopbullying; tar -czpvf stopbullying.tar.gz *; s3cmd put stopbullying.tar.gz s3://ctac-migrate/

	* Copy the /appdata/www/stopbullying folder:
	cd /appdata/www/stopbullying; tar -czpvf appdata-www-stopbullying.tar.gz *; s3cmd put appdata-www-stopbullying.tar.gz s3://ctac-migrate/

	- Ensure that ~/.ssh/* (syndication.*) is copied, if not done so already
	sudo su — stopbully; cd ~; tar -czpvf stopbully-ssh-stuff.tar.gz *
	as root user: s3cmd put stopbully-ssh-stuff.tar.gz s3://ctac-migrate/

	- On perc-migration-as-01:
	sudo su 
	cd /appdata/stopbullying
	s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/stopbullying.tar.gz
	s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/stopbully-ssh-stuff.tar.gz
	s3cmd get s3://ctac-migrate/appdata-www-stopbullying.tar.gz
	chown stopbully:stopbully stopbullying.tar.gz stopbully-ssh-stuff.tar.gz appdata-www-stopbullying.tar.gz
	sudo su - stopbully
	cd /appdata/stopbully (might need to make this directory)
	tar -zxvf stopbullying.tar.gz
	tar -zxvf stopbully-ssh-stuff.tar.gz

	cd /appdata/www/stopbully (might need to make this directory too)
	mv ~/appdata-www-stopbullying.tar.gz .
	tar -zxvf appdata-www-stopbullying.tar.gz

- run the migration.sh (migration_12.sh) script on perc-migration-as-01
	cd /appdata/
	sh migration12.sh -…something…i can’t remember the flags. it’s database IP, and database name and user
        - select port 9992
	- answer no to 64-bit java.
	- Answer no to SSO
- migrate the database from the On Demand instance to perc-migration-db-01:
	- mysqldump -u -p --databases vaccines | s3cmd put - s3://ctac-migrate/perc-vaccines-db-dump.sql
	- then a regular mysql import 
- start Rhythmx on perc-migration-as-01
I	sudo su - stopbully
	cd /appdata/stopbully/Rhythmx/bin
	./Rhythmx start ..

- Update the ticket and wait for Aquilent to apply their update.
- Configure Apache vhost on the web server. (this is cloud-ws-01)
The target Apache server will be proxy-01. You will need to create the vhost based on the file that contains something like <instance>.cloud.hhs.gov wcms-<instance>.cloud.hhs.gov
- Once Aquilent is done, they will notify you via the ticket of their status
- Migrate the app from perc-migration-as-01 to the Reserved Instance…instance. Make sure you are selecting the correct instance by checking the tags.
- Migrate the database from perc-migration-db-01 to the RDS instance
- Run the migration script (migration_14.sh)
	- be sure to select ‘y’ for SSO and updating Java.
	- no need to change port.
- Start Rhythmx
	sudo su - stopbully
	cd /appdata/stopbully/Rhythmx/bin
	./Rhythmx start ..
- Update the ticket with your work.
- Once Aquilent has said testing is complete on the Reserved Instance server, move the contents of /appdata/mentalheath/bin-bak to /appdata/mentalhealth/bin
- Include ssh keys
From the old server, go to /appdata/stopbully/.ssh. Tar up the hhs* and syndication* keys



Misc notes:
- The morning after the first step of each migration, we have a followup call with Aquilent that starts at 8:15am. The dial in details are:
	Dial +1 (646) 749-3122
	Access Code: 576-184-733
- if all else fails stopping Rhythmx, do a kill -9, start Rhythmx up again, and then try Rhythmx stop .. (again).
- also confirm /etc/hosts has correct hostname for 127.0.0.1
- If you get an error about the DEFINER when doing mysql import, you will need to obtain a new dump using the following as an example:
  mysqldump --single-transaction -u hhsweb -p --database tobacco |  grep -v "50013 DEFINER"  > perc-migration-db-01-tobacco.sql
- confirm java version:
stopbullying@hhs-percussion-01:~/Rhythmyx$ JRE/bin/java -version
java version "1.7.0_79"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.7.0_79-b15)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.79-b02, mixed mode)
stopbullying@hhs-percussion-01:~/Rhythmyx$
- confirm wcms URL in /appdata/stopbullying/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/rxapp.ear/rxapp.war/rxlogin.jsp
- update ~/rsync-stage-cloud-ORIGIN.sh
- Robert will probably ask about the user’s default password. check 1password



- Sample output of the migration-12.sh script:
root@perc-migration-as-01:/appdata# sh migration-12.04.sh -i tobacco -d tobacco -s 10.153.85.221
Rhythmyx Port is 9992, are you sure you want to continue? (y/n) y
Checking if process is already running
The process is not Running.. Continuing ..
Editing Percussion Files to make the instance Linux and System Compatible
=================
Modifying /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/rx-ds.xml
Modifying /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/rxapp.ear/rxapp.war/WEB-INF/config/spring/install-beans.xml
Modifying /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/rxconfig/Installer/rxrepository.properties
cleaning up JBOSS's log, tmp and work directory
Cleaning .dbg_.sys_CEhandler, .sys_CEHandler and lucene indexes
Updating RX port and redirect port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/jboss-web.deployer/server.xml and /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/RxServices.war/WEB-INF/web.xml
Updating RX Naming Service Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/conf/jboss-service.xml
Updating RX RMI Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/conf/jboss-service.xml
Updating RMI JRMP Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/conf/jboss-service.xml
Updating RX Pooled Invoker Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/conf/jboss-service.xml
Updating RX JMX UIL2 Service Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/jms/uil2-service.xml
Updating RX pub port and Redirect Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/jboss-web.deployer/server.xml
Updating RX Port and Redirect Port on /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/jboss-web.deployer/server.xml
Updating Shutdown script
Modifing /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/rxapp.ear/rxapp.war/WEB-INF/config/user/spring/PSORestAPI-beans.xml
Can't open /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx/AppServer/server/rx/deploy/rxapp.ear/rxapp.war/WEB-INF/config/user/spring/PSORestAPI-beans.xml: No such file or directory.
moving bin folder to disable rsync
migration-12.04.sh: 156: migration-12.04.sh: File: not found
creating publishing folder
Fixing the Permission on the /appdata/tobacco/Rhythmyx
Modification of Rhythmyx instance complete, try starting Rhythmyx, hopefully everything works as expected
Do you want to upgrade Java to 64 bit (y/n) n
Do you want to configure AMS (y/n) n
Modification of Rhythmyx instance is complete, try starting Rhythmyx, hopefully everything works as expected

item.description:

Subject: Important Rhythmyx/Percussion configuration files

General Rythmyx App Server Config (Java heap/memory config)

/appdata/<user>/Rhythmyx/Rhythmyx.bin.lax



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be

item.title: sensu
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Troubleshooting Sensu Keep Alive

Revision History:
    2015-07-28 09:30 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Links:
- http://www.milanpopovic.me/vagrant-and-local-tmp-folder-write-permissions/

Prerequisites:
- You are on the appropriate VPN where the server resides.

Symptoms:
- Emails being received with Keep alive in the subject or body of the email
- Receiving Slack notifications for Keep Alive messages.

Troubleshooting approaches:
- ping the server. If you don’t get a response, log into the AWS Console and check the running status of the server. 
- ssh into the server. Success? great. if not, repeat the previous step.
- check the status of the sensu-client daemon. Sample output:

root@toolstack-01:~# /etc/init.d/sensu-client status
 * sensu-client is stopped


- In the above, notice that the daemon is stopped. You can start it with:
/etc/init.d/sensu-client start
- Then check the status. Check slack or email for the resolving notification.


Misc troubleshooting
If you run into the below error, it’s likely the permissions of the /tmp folder. Try chmod’ing it to 1777 (chmod 1777 /tmp)

/opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/2.0.0/tmpdir.rb:34:in `tmpdir': could not find a temporary directory (ArgumentError)
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-settings-3.0.0/lib/sensu/settings/loader.rb:336:in `create_loaded_tempfile!'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-settings-3.0.0/lib/sensu/settings/loader.rb:140:in `set_env!'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-settings-3.0.0/lib/sensu/settings.rb:27:in `load'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-settings-3.0.0/lib/sensu/settings.rb:38:in `get'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-0.20.1/lib/sensu/daemon.rb:85:in `load_settings'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-0.20.1/lib/sensu/daemon.rb:47:in `initialize'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-0.20.1/lib/sensu/client/process.rb:29:in `initialize'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-0.20.1/lib/sensu/client/process.rb:17:in `new'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-0.20.1/lib/sensu/client/process.rb:17:in `run'
        from /opt/sensu/embedded/lib/ruby/gems/2.0.0/gems/sensu-0.20.1/bin/sensu-client:10:in `<top (required)>'
        from /opt/sensu/bin/sensu-client:23:in `load'
        from /opt/sensu/bin/sensu-client:23:in `<main>'



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: sensu erlang and rabbitmq compatibility version fix
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Sensu erlang and rabbitmq Compatibility version fix

Revision History:
    2018-08-30 13:28:00 - Version 1 created by Bao

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

Applies to:
 - Sensu/erlang & rabbitmq

Links:
    monitor.cloud.hhs.gov

Background:
- Reports have stated that the current latest version of erlang(1:21.xx) does not work with sensu. 

apt-get -y install erlang-base=1:20.3*
apt-get -y install erlang-mode=1:20.3* 
apt-get -y install esl-erlang=1:20.3* 
apt-get -y install rabbitmq-server

or for an earlier version:
apt-get -y install erlang-base=1:20.1*
apt-get -y install erlang-mode=1:20.1* 
apt-get -y install esl-erlang=1:20.1* 
apt-get -y install rabbitmq-server

Then follow the guide on pinning the version of erlang:
https://www.rabbitmq.com/install-debian.html

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: sensu tips and best practices
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Sensu Best Practices and Information

Revision History:
    2015-02-05 19:44:53 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

    Config:
    * /etc/sensu/ is the  location for configs, plugins and handlers.
    * /etc/defaults/sensu should be set to use embedded ruby.
    * DO NOT leave any unused/uneeded JSON files in the sensu path (/etc/sensu).. it will pick them up..

    Checks:
    * Do a good job of setting subscribers.  It is like roles.
    * The check's ruby exit code (0,1,2,3..) reflect the severity (ok, warning, critical, custom) respectively.
        - Matched the severity config in the handler's json. (e.g. "severities": [ "critical", "warning", "ok" ])


    Handlers:
    * depending on the what is being checked
        - set:
                "handle": true,
                "occurrences": 1,
                 "refesh": 100,

        .. in the check's json config.  this tells sensu to apply the handler every nth occurences and wait for x occurances before handling again.


    Troubleshooting:
    * If the API is not running.. You most likely have a json issue..



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: solr_installation
item.description:
Download  http://www.apache.org/dyn/closer.lua/lucene/solr/5.5.0

copy /opt

follow link to install

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-solr-5-2-1-on-ubuntu-14-04

after installation create brick under opt/solr


bin/solr create -c syndication


change porton SydicationSharedConfig.groovy


//___________________________
// Syndication Solr Search   \___________________________________________________________
//_______________________________________________________________________________________
syndication.solrService.serverAddress = "http://localhost:8983/solr/syndication"
syndication.solrService.useSolr = true


Reindex content under syndication application

item.title: solr_installation 1
item.description:
Download  http://www.apache.org/dyn/closer.lua/lucene/solr/5.5.0

copy /opt

follow link to install

https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-solr-5-2-1-on-ubuntu-14-04

after installation create brick under opt/solr


bin/solr create -c syndication


change porton SydicationSharedConfig.groovy


//___________________________
// Syndication Solr Search   \___________________________________________________________
//_______________________________________________________________________________________
syndication.solrService.serverAddress = "http://localhost:8983/solr/syndication"
syndication.solrService.useSolr = true


Reindex content under syndication application

item.title: vault unseal if sealed
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Responding to Vault sealed monitor alert
Revision History:
    2016-06-12 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor
    2017-08-11 - Version 2 - prigor - update for ssl

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

An alert similar to the following is CRITICAL.   It will occur any time a vault/vault host is restarted.  It should be unsealed immediately.  If processes that use vault can not reach an unsealed vault, configuration loss may occur if the process is not resiliant.

CheckJson CRITICAL: key check failed: unexpected value for key: 'false' != 'true'

Admin GUI: http://sensu.svsc.east.gsa.local
Host: consul-1.svcs.east.gsa.local
Timestamp: 2016-06-11 05:15:36 +0000
Address:  10.151.228.64
Check Name:  vault_1_sealed
Command:  /opt/sensu/embedded/bin/ruby /opt/sensu/embedded/bin/check-http-json.rb -u http://10.151.228.64:8200/v1/sys/seal-status -K sealed -v false
Status:  CRITICAL
Occurrences:  1

Source: https://www.vaultproject.io/docs/concepts/seal.html

Steps:

1) VPN into affected environment
2) SSH into host with sealed vault
3) Export vault connection env variables:
  export VAULT_ADDR="http://127.0.0.1:8200" (if not running ssl like modeast.gsa.local)
4) exec: vault unseal
  enter key: (see 1Password: {env} - vault keys and token (e.g GSA - vault keys and token))
5) repeat step 4 with another key.  It takes a quorum of 2 keys to unlock.

After keys have been entered.. vault will show unsealed.

IMPORTANT:  Normally the keys are distributed among people and it takes the quorum to unseal.  We are such a small team, for now, the keys will be stored in 1Password - SysAdmin vault and a single person can unlock.
